articles.author: HUIZHONG WU / AP
articles.title: Some Shanghai Businesses to Reopen Monday, Officials Say
articles.description: Supermarkets, malls and restaurants in Shanghai will be allowed to open in a limited capacity starting Monday, officials said, even while it remained unclear whether residents would be let out from their homes.

articles.title: Ukrainian Band Kalush Orchestra Wins Eurovision Amid War
articles.description: Ukrainian band Kalush Orchestra won the Eurovision Song Contest, a clear show of popular support for the group's war-ravaged nation that went beyond music.
articles.content:

articles.author: Time
articles.title: Finland Announces It Wants to Join NATO
articles.description: Finland declared Sunday that it wants to join NATO, as a senior official with the western military alliance expressed hope that — with Russia's military advance appearing to falter — Ukraine can win the war.

articles.title: Ten Dead in Buffalo Supermarket Attack Police Call a Hate Crime
articles.description: A white 18-year-old wearing military gear and livestreaming with a helmet camera opened fire with a rifle at a supermarket in Buffalo, killing 10 people and wounding three others Saturday in what authorities described as “racially motivated violent extremism.”
